cleaned_text: Everything You Need to Know About COVID-19 & Down Syndrome Booster Updates Spanish Coming Soon COVID-19 Vaccine Advocacy DSMIG on IDD COVID-19 Vaccination [Crnic & Others' Research Calls for Early Vaccination](https://www.sciencemag.org/news/2020/12/covid-19-10-times-deadlier-people-down-syndrome-raising-calls-early-vaccination) Down [COVID-19 EMERGENCY RELIEF GLOBAL GRANTS](https://www.globaldownsyndrome.org/covid-19-relief-grants/) Applications Under Review [Read about the impact of last year's cycle ](https://www.globaldownsyndrome.org/global-syndrome-foundation-awards-116k-covid-19-relief-grants-140-families-42-syndrome-orgs-need//) A Message to Our Family, Friends, Colleagues & Supporters GLOBAL and our affiliates have received numerous inquiries about whether or not people with Down syndrome are more at risk than typical people when it comes to exposure to the COVID-19 coronavirus. Many inquiries are related to health risks and many are also related to spring break travel on planes. With COVID-19 coronavirus being categorized as an official [pandemic](https://www.who.int/dg/speeches/detail/who-director-general-s-opening-remarks-at-the-media-briefing-on-covid-19---11-march-2020) by the World Health Organization, and after discussing with our affiliates, at this moment in time we are comfortable providing the following information. At GLOBAL, we recognize that every family and individual has their unique situation, and we stand ready to support you where we can. Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions. In the meantime please be safe!
